snippet: A federal appeals panel ruled that BP must pay gulf companies for damages without requiring proof of harm by the Deepwater Horizon spill.
abstract: Federal appeals court Judge Leslie H Southwick rules that BP is bound by compensation agreement it signed with regard to 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill and must pay some gulf businesses for economic damage without their having to prove it was caused by the Deepwater Horizon disaster.

byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and JOHN SCHWARTZ

lead_paragraph: A federal appeals panel ruled that BP must pay gulf companies for damages without requiring proof of harm by the Deepwater Horizon spill.

headline.main: Court Says BP’s Spill Agreement Is Binding
headline.print_headline: Court Says BP’s Spill Agreement Is Binding
